dict.string: Tap the highlighted button
Tap twice to set the marker
Tap to continue
Professor, welcome to the Console. Cool interface, isn't it? I hope you like it because you'll spend the next weeks looking at it and drinking coffee.
The Console shows you data collected by satellites deployed around the planet.
The mission takes place within this landscape. It is full of features, from the highlighted arid region to forests rich in resources.
You can tap anytime the goal icon to show a summary of the environment.
These are your bots. We have deployed a small initial population in this area.
This first mission has one dispersal goal. You should drive your bots to the blinking hexagon in your bottom right.
Tap the Play button to see what are your bots doing.
The bots move, reproduce and die on their own, but you can guide them using some cool tools.
The first one is the orientation marker. Tap twice in any place of the map to suggest the dispersal direction.
The second one is the evolution track. You begin with 10 EvoPoints and receive additional points during the mission.
EvoPoints are used to increase the three attributes. Tap here to spend 1 EvoPoint and upgrade Mobility to Level 2.
Reproduction controls the fertility of your bots. Move it to level 2.
Each change of an attribute costs 1 additional EvoPoints, as it is highlighted in yellow. Increase it to 3.
Tap again to set Reproduction to 4.
Increasing Resistance improves the survival skills of your bots. Spend the remanining on this attribute.
Use the remaining 2 EvoPoints to increase Resistance again.
Deployment finished! Let's see if the bots survive with these traits.
This panel shows how your population is increasing. Set now the orientation marker within the goal zone.
As you can see here you received additional EvoPoints. Good luck!
Some missions have more than one goal as shown in the top of the Console.
The bright interval shows the time when your population needs to reach the zone according to archaeological evidence. If you arrive before or after this span the mission will fail.
The best arrival time is marked by the highlighted zone.
Welcome Professor. You will use a new tool in this mission.
The technical term is Temporary Augmentation of Population Attributes Through Bursts in Cultural Traits.
The team just call them Boosts.
You can spend EvoPoints to activate them and temporally increase an attribute.
The first one increases Reproduction. Tap it now.
The second Boost increases Resistance, and it has an area of effect. You need to tap and drag towards the zone you wish to improve your bots.
Boosts have a cooldown period so use them wisely. Good luck!
The second Goal of this mission checks the size of your group
You need to reach the size highlighted in red here within the assigned time span.
